markdown: TOUCHDOWN (Continued) MAUI TO DINE ROBAIRE'S SEAFOOD RES- TAURANT - Wailea Town Cen- ter. All kinds of seafood: scampi, lobster, finger lobster, abalone, clams, oysters and famous Bouil- labaise Marseillaise. Daily, lunch & dinner: 11:30a.m.-10 p.m. Lunch from $3, dinner from $6, plenty of parking, casual dress, call for reservations 879-4677. GARY BURGHOFF'S FROZEN YOGURT-764 Front St., Lahai- na. Frozen yogurt delights-cones, sundaes (with an infinite variety of toppings), fruit and yogurt crepes, banana splits and snacks. Open daily from 9 a.m.-10p.m. The al fresco dining area and charm- ing decor invite a yogurt break (just 25 calories per ounce) and you might get a glimpse of TV's lovable "Radar" from "M.A.S.H." Phone 661-3538. MAUI PALMS EAST-WEST DIN- ING ROOM - On the Bay at Ka- hului. Famous since 1953 for Ha- waiian hospitality. Dining special- ties include seafood, steaks and chicken in the American mode and 17 tasty, succulent Japanese dinner - sukiyaki, tempura, teri- yaki and tofu dishes, and an excel- lent wine list. Daily hours, break- fast 709:30, lunch 11-1:30 and dinner, with Hawaiian entertain- - ment 5:30-8:30, Sunday buffet 6-8. Reservations, 877-0071. SHIP'S WHEEL - Whaler's Mar- ket Place, 505 Front St., Lahaina. 661-4806. Ask the chef for his gourmet choice of the day. Lunch features fish and chips. Fine dining on shrimp, lobster, crab and deli- cious mahimahi. Lunch 11:30- 2:30, Dinner from 6 daily. Danc- ing, Wed., Fri., and Sat, nights. THE RUSTY HARPOON - Whaler's Village, on the beach at Kaanapali. 661-3123. The "Daquiri Capital of the World" Rusty says, "Come as you are." The Bar opens at 11:30 a.m.; Lunch, 11-3:30; Happy Hour 3:30-6; Dinner, 6-10. Bring in your coupon from this magazine for a FREE LUNCH. Phone for reservations. WHALERS' MARKET PLACE Luau on the beach, every Wed. night from 6-8. Enjoy hulihuli pig, poi, lomi salmon, free MaiTais plus a Hawaiian show. Adults $14.95, children 6-12 $7.60, chil- dren under 6 free. Res. 661-4631. KOA HOUSE — Menehune Shores Hotel, 760 So. Kihei Rd., Kihei. 879-3677. Chinese cuisine and cur- rent art exhibits. Specialties al- mond duck, chicken with oyster sauce, lemon chicken and lobster Canton. Complete menu available for take-out. Daily, Lunch 11-2, Dinner, 6-10. Dancing nightly til closing. Call for dinner reservations. CHATEAU DU LOUP — Whaler's Market Place, 505 Front St., La- haina. 661-8966. The finest in French cuisine in a memorable set- ting. Taste, style, the personal touch and reasonable prices. Din- ner 7:30-10 daily. Reservations. THE ITALIAN RESTAURANT - Whaler's Market Place, 505 Front St., Lahaina. 661-3288. For deli- cious Italian food and a beautiful view of the sun setting. Fine selec- tion of California wines. Call for reservations. DON TACO MEXICAN RESTAU- RANT — Authentic homestyle Mexican food is the order of the day and evening. Interesting menu of tacos, taco salads, enchiladas, tostadas, burritos, plus their own specialty, taco burgers. Everything is grown or made locally fresh with- out preservatives. In Maui Mall. Open 7 days a week starting at 11 a.m. till 10 p.m., Sundays till 7 p.m. DON DRYSDALE'S WHALER'S PUB — 505 Front St., Whaler's Market Place, cocktails and food served continuously from 10-2 a.m. on the oceanfront, sandwiches and burgers. 661-3303. THE FISH FRY — Lahaina Shop- ping Center. Freshly caught Maui fish and the best of imported deli- cacies served daily at reasonable prices. French fries or rice and cole slaw or club salad available with all entrees. Mahimahi and specialties such as Captain's Plate — white fish, scallops and shrimp cooked in a tasty secret batter. From 10:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m., in a nautical atmosphere. Phone 667-9243. WAILEA STEAK HOUSE — On the Wailea Golf Course, five min. from Town Center. A Hawaiian dining experience; steak and lob- ster, scampi, mahimahi, Korean ribs, Maui catfish, fish chowders and the famous "all you can eat" salad bar with fresh hot breads. Lunch 11 a.m.-4 p.m.; dinner, 5:30- 10 p.m.; cocktails 9 a.m. to mid- night, daily. Res. 879-2875. FAIRWAY RESTAURANT - Wailea Golf Course, past Maui Inter-Continental Hotel. Open daily for breakfast and lunch, 6:30 a.m.-9:30 p.m; dinner, Mon. -Sat. 6:30-9:30 with cocktails un- til 11. American, country-style and salads at luncheon. A Conti- nental menu at dinner with lob- ster tail, steaks, catch-of-the-day, roast prime beef. Call 879-4060. KIHEI VILLAGE FISH HOUSE -1947 Kihei Rd. at Kalama Park in mid-Kihei, 879-1545. Reservations a good idea. Dinner only, 7 nights a week, 5:30-10, $7.25-$13.50, except lobster, $15.00. Specialties: Fresh Hawaiian fish, caught daily off Maui, prepared 5 ways. Imported shellfish, midwest beef, fresh homemade rolls, cakes. (Continued on page 45) Sew Hawaiian WITH HAWAII'S VERY OWN HOME SEWING PATTERNS <::logo: PAULO A PATTERNS PAULO A PATTERNS The logo features the text "PAULO A" in a large, stylized, rounded, sans-serif font, with "PATTERNS" in a smaller, similar font below it, all in white on a dark rectangular background.::> patterns pacifica <::Illustration of six stylized female figures modeling various clothing designs. The figures are drawn in a fashion illustration style, with elongated limbs and distinct facial features. The clothing includes a ruffled dress, a strapless dress with a bow, a belted tunic, a V-neck dress, another V-neck dress, and a form-fitting jumpsuit. The figures are arranged in a group, with some standing and one seated.:figure::> and look for POAKALANI'S Hawaiian Quilting patterns. Easy to sew, fun to wear. Over 100 different styles to choose from. Traditional muumuus, holokus and the latest young casual fashion designs. Yours to select from at better fabric shops through- out the islands. Create your own special allure. 22 Latitude 20/November 1978

such as Captain's Plate — white fish, scallops and shrimp cooked in a tasty secret batter. From 10:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m., in a nautical atmosphere. Phone 667-9243.

FAIRWAY RESTAURANT - Wailea Golf Course, past Maui Inter-Continental Hotel. Open daily for breakfast and lunch, 6:30 a.m.-9:30 p.m; dinner, Mon. -Sat. 6:30-9:30 with cocktails un- til 11. American, country-style and salads at luncheon. A Conti- nental menu at dinner with lob- ster tail, steaks, catch-of-the-day, roast prime beef. Call 879-4060.

KIHEI VILLAGE FISH HOUSE -1947 Kihei Rd. at Kalama Park in mid-Kihei, 879-1545. Reservations a good idea. Dinner only, 7 nights a week, 5:30-10, $7.25-$13.50, except lobster, $15.00. patterns pacifica <::Illustration of six stylized female figures modeling various clothing designs. The figures are drawn in a fashion illustration style, with elongated limbs and distinct facial features. The clothing includes a ruffled dress, a strapless dress with a bow, a belted tunic, a V-neck dress, another V-neck dress, and a form-fitting jumpsuit. Over 100 different styles to choose from. Traditional muumuus, holokus and the latest young casual fashion designs. Yours to select from at better fabric shops through- out the islands. Create your own special allure.
Latitude 20/November 1978
